questions.question: How do I add images to a document?
questions.answer: Call `addOnUISdk.app.document.addImage(blob, attributes, importAddOnData)` with image blob and optional MediaAttributes and ImportAddOnData.

questions.question: What parameters does addImage require?
questions.answer: A Blob object is required. MediaAttributes (title, author) and ImportAddOnData (custom metadata) are optional.

questions.question: How do I get an image as a blob?
questions.answer: Use `fetch(imageUrl).then(r => r.blob())` to convert images to blob format.

questions.question: Can I use local image files?
questions.answer: Yes, use relative paths from add-on root with fetch() to load local images.

questions.question: How do I add animated GIFs?
questions.answer: Use `addOnUISdk.app.document.addAnimatedImage(blob, attributes, importAddOnData)` instead of addImage().

questions.question: Why doesn't addImage work with GIFs?
questions.answer: addImage() converts animations to static images; use addAnimatedImage() to preserve animation.

questions.question: What image formats are supported?
questions.answer: AI, GIF, JPEG, JPG, PNG, PSD, PSDT, and WEBP. 8000px or 80MB.

questions.question: Are there GIF size limitations?
questions.answer: Yes, refer to the FAQ section for specific GIF size and weight limitations.

questions.question: How do I replace media in an existing `MediaContainerNode`?
questions.answer: Use the `replaceMedia()` method on a `MediaContainerNode` with a BitmapImage` object created via `Editor.loadBitmapImage()`.

questions.question: Can I replace any media type with `replaceMedia()`?
questions.answer: Currently, `replaceMedia()` only accepts `BitmapImage` objects. The original media can be any type, but replacement must be a static image.

questions.question: How do I attach custom metadata to imported images?
questions.answer: Use the optional `importAddOnData` parameter with `nodeAddOnData` and `mediaAddOnData` objects to store custom metadata that can be retrieved later via document sandbox APIs.
